UX Principles

# 

<span key="5b42fd803ec845b8bf2e9222416f6ea9"><span offset-key="5b42fd803ec845b8bf2e9222416f6ea9:0">UX Principles</span></span>

## 

<span key="6c7ff1aaad05479786de20ac1674c0ed"><span offset-key="6c7ff1aaad05479786de20ac1674c0ed:0">What is UX?</span></span>

<span key="678eaf00774b400eaf4444eb279d60c1"><span offset-key="678eaf00774b400eaf4444eb279d60c1:0">If the title of this module didn't already give it away, UX stands for </span>**user experience**<span offset-key="678eaf00774b400eaf4444eb279d60c1:2">. UX is, ultimately, </span>**what users experience**<span offset-key="678eaf00774b400eaf4444eb279d60c1:4"> when using a product.</span></span>

<span key="25eb9418f397467395552a104409dd8f"><span offset-key="25eb9418f397467395552a104409dd8f:0">We can hear you from here: "Well, that's vague." An apt observation! "UX" is a </span>*super*<span offset-key="25eb9418f397467395552a104409dd8f:2"> general term, and it's also constantly evolving. That's largely because user experience is a relatively new area of study, and we're learning more and more as products and the technologies used to build them evolve at an exponential pace.</span></span>

## 

<span key="3476faeb8c1241cb828d7ec73cc2bceb"><span offset-key="3476faeb8c1241cb828d7ec73cc2bceb:0">UX vs. UI</span></span>

<span key="8e549870cab14d96b3737b8f952ad4d2"><span offset-key="8e549870cab14d96b3737b8f952ad4d2:0">You've likely seen these terms bandied about, used interchangeably, or even in combination with each other: UI, UX, UI/UX, design, interaction design, UI design, UX design...</span></span>

<span key="e2bfb7b0a99646e3a6c06c5edf33b340"><span offset-key="e2bfb7b0a99646e3a6c06c5edf33b340:0">UI stands for </span>**user interface**<span offset-key="e2bfb7b0a99646e3a6c06c5edf33b340:2"> (though </span>*sometimes*<span offset-key="e2bfb7b0a99646e3a6c06c5edf33b340:4"> it can stand for "user interaction"â€”this isn't helping, is it...)</span></span>

<span key="154795a045d14013902c74b33c39ad69"><span offset-key="154795a045d14013902c74b33c39ad69:0">Ultimately, the distinction between these terms does matter, but </span>**it doesn't matter too much**<span offset-key="154795a045d14013902c74b33c39ad69:2">. What matters is that you understand that they represent various areas of focus that are ultimately trying to get at the same thing from different anglesâ€”</span>**how is a thing used**<span offset-key="154795a045d14013902c74b33c39ad69:4">?</span></span>

<span key="ea28a6d95f9a4429b361a845ddf6f24a">**User experience (UX) design**<span offset-key="ea28a6d95f9a4429b361a845ddf6f24a:1"> focuses on what happens to the user when they use the thing.</span></span>

<span key="827852fd707b40078493be899c1a32a6">**User interface (UI) design**<span offset-key="827852fd707b40078493be899c1a32a6:1"> focuses on the pieces of the thing the user interacts withâ€”hopefully informed by an anticipation and understanding of what their experience will or should be.</span></span>

## 

<span key="14d8c03a11374cd682dd0050e9eaae24"><span offset-key="14d8c03a11374cd682dd0050e9eaae24:0">UX Principles</span></span>

<span key="630350fe762e4613b48600fc06623191"><span offset-key="630350fe762e4613b48600fc06623191:0">in 2004, </span></span><a href="http://semanticstudios.com/user_experience_design/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d3f91d8a1251467984b477b5c41b61ee" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-46006_259-46007-237__"><span data-key="55ea342f1cfc43579f908828c1006dbb"><span data-offset-key="55ea342f1cfc43579f908828c1006dbb:0">Peter Morville (Links to an external site.)</span></span></span></a><span key="3e0cbfda82d04b6aa52f332e013f557b"><span offset-key="3e0cbfda82d04b6aa52f332e013f557b:0"> defined a core set of seven UX principles determining whether users will get value out of an experience:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="9fe3d0f18e204d5697dbc25fc05d38bb"><span offset-key="9fe3d0f18e204d5697dbc25fc05d38bb:0">useful</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="4bf639b7163a4b24b3cf8c0548cecd20"><span offset-key="4bf639b7163a4b24b3cf8c0548cecd20:0">usable</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="40c03eeeebc64b69aedd6eda92cbe35c"><span offset-key="40c03eeeebc64b69aedd6eda92cbe35c:0">desirable</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="25c66d662e4a425e84f75fb81b0a7e22"><span offset-key="25c66d662e4a425e84f75fb81b0a7e22:0">valuable</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="47692bb482b84a86a01bd38533bab4ae"><span offset-key="47692bb482b84a86a01bd38533bab4ae:0">findable</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="6b542687f2394131b22c02a72fe262a6"><span offset-key="6b542687f2394131b22c02a72fe262a6:0">accessible</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="21611a3b9d6a485f8e19ff9203bc7780"><span offset-key="21611a3b9d6a485f8e19ff9203bc7780:0">credible</span></span>

<span key="f676094f993842de98c543f6f22f61b2"><span offset-key="f676094f993842de98c543f6f22f61b2:0">Like our seven principles of design, these seven principles of UX certainly aren't the only way to break up and talk about UX. But they do give us a helpful anchor for discussion!</span></span>

<span key="35a828cff65d4f0292ebd7ea42ae2a19"><span offset-key="35a828cff65d4f0292ebd7ea42ae2a19:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="5bab2590238e4a05983920e6af699b19"><span offset-key="5bab2590238e4a05983920e6af699b19:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="10d4866ac43b43629359f7bb81057bbf"><span offset-key="10d4866ac43b43629359f7bb81057bbf:0">User Research</span></span>

<span key="8fbd78db8e4943bfa9be4c72465ebf42"><span offset-key="8fbd78db8e4943bfa9be4c72465ebf42:0">One of the core activities in UX is conducting user research. Research helps you refine your understanding of how users will interact with a product, what they'll think, and even what they'll </span>*feel*<span offset-key="8fbd78db8e4943bfa9be4c72465ebf42:2">.</span></span>

<span key="3beffe6f488a45cdbdc56667cfcbe29d"><span offset-key="3beffe6f488a45cdbdc56667cfcbe29d:0">The idea that we should focus on what users are </span>*feeling*<span offset-key="3beffe6f488a45cdbdc56667cfcbe29d:2"> when they're using our product might strike you as weird or silly, but it's actually </span>*the ultimate way*<span offset-key="3beffe6f488a45cdbdc56667cfcbe29d:4"> to zero in on building the right thing. If users enjoy using your product, they'll use it often, maybe purchase it if that's the business model, tell their friends about it, write epic poems about it...</span></span>

<span key="daac674bbddf41fdb00c5f367af0f83b"><span offset-key="daac674bbddf41fdb00c5f367af0f83b:0">When users use a product, they're constantly making both conscious and unconscious observations about their experience:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="4067919f91084cf98443bd2272b650d3"><span offset-key="4067919f91084cf98443bd2272b650d3:0">"This is </span>*frustrating*<span offset-key="4067919f91084cf98443bd2272b650d3:2">â€”I'm trying to go back, but I can't!"</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="499c31dcb88940bf904e0a32299a8196"><span offset-key="499c31dcb88940bf904e0a32299a8196:0">"This is </span>*so neat*<span offset-key="499c31dcb88940bf904e0a32299a8196:2">â€”I can slide here and see the graph change right away!"</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="500fd1bb8df6432abe4953d522470eb9"><span offset-key="500fd1bb8df6432abe4953d522470eb9:0">"I really </span>*wish*<span offset-key="500fd1bb8df6432abe4953d522470eb9:2"> I could see that other table right next to this one to compare them directly."</span></span>

<span key="2a3ca6994fb04f4ea4154e80597c1256"><span offset-key="2a3ca6994fb04f4ea4154e80597c1256:0">We should always try to </span>*anticipate*<span offset-key="2a3ca6994fb04f4ea4154e80597c1256:2"> how our users will experience our productâ€”but ultimately, </span>*we'll never be able to anticipate everything*<span offset-key="2a3ca6994fb04f4ea4154e80597c1256:4">. That's why user research can be so usefulâ€”it lets us cheat by getting more information!</span></span>

## 

<span key="450344d2d1454d5c9f6f7e60619467c2"><span offset-key="450344d2d1454d5c9f6f7e60619467c2:0">User Research Methods</span></span>

<span key="66a64ebcda6e483a8a13d3bdfe73ca8d"><span offset-key="66a64ebcda6e483a8a13d3bdfe73ca8d:0">Let's say you're working on a product that lets homebuyers shop and apply for a mortgage. How would you conduct some user research to point you in the right direction?</span></span>

### 

<span key="ec6f76eb05634c0bb17ef257491eb6d4"><span offset-key="ec6f76eb05634c0bb17ef257491eb6d4:0">Discovery</span></span>

<span key="256474924f9241a5b3795b89b31ee480">**Discovery**<span offset-key="256474924f9241a5b3795b89b31ee480:1"> is usually the first step in UX design research. It focuses on finding or generating some initial information to get oriented about a problem space and the people facing those problems.</span></span>

<span key="0c70485bdf6147b5bf0aad85f708f5a0"><span offset-key="0c70485bdf6147b5bf0aad85f708f5a0:0">Discovery is broad and often purposefully open-ended; you're just trying to figure out: "what's going on here?"</span></span>

<span key="288da4dbbf174d1fab59c4eadba13062"><span offset-key="288da4dbbf174d1fab59c4eadba13062:0">Common tools for discovery include:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="380e1c936db04b2a86bd2134c059c197">**reading**<span offset-key="380e1c936db04b2a86bd2134c059c197:1"> articles and studies (e.g., about the housing market, the mortgage lending industry, public policy...)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="6d2b208ffdbe49db89058ad4e2e578bb">**interviewing**<span offset-key="6d2b208ffdbe49db89058ad4e2e578bb:1"> people facing a problem you're interested in solving with your product (e.g., recent, active, or potential homebuyers) or people adjacent to those problems (e.g., interviewing someone working for a mortgage lender to learn more about the mortgage application process)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="db971bb72e104fba966b1f1d17ddda1b">**holding workshops**<span offset-key="db971bb72e104fba966b1f1d17ddda1b:1"> with various combinations of stakeholder groups (</span>**stakeholder:**<span offset-key="db971bb72e104fba966b1f1d17ddda1b:3"> anyone with a "stake" in the development process)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="81d8d3bac1bc4a4e97ff8d915663f6da">**gathering data**<span offset-key="81d8d3bac1bc4a4e97ff8d915663f6da:1"> (e.g., from real mortgage applications)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="ce7168bc1fd7470cb60315cefa816bdb">**taking notes**<span offset-key="ce7168bc1fd7470cb60315cefa816bdb:1"> based on your own experiences (e.g., applying for a mortgage)</span></span>

### 

<span key="99b56d06bec147e3a47fdf237fb52390"><span offset-key="99b56d06bec147e3a47fdf237fb52390:0">Exploration</span></span>

<span key="56d2e8bdc16347779b7bb70a56a90255">**Exploration**<span offset-key="56d2e8bdc16347779b7bb70a56a90255:1"> is a bit less open-ended than discovery, and involves actually diving into the information you've generated.</span></span>

<span key="db7f86895a194eabab3b8fa58e32988b"><span offset-key="db7f86895a194eabab3b8fa58e32988b:0">Usually, a major goal of the exploration process is </span>**feature mapping**<span offset-key="db7f86895a194eabab3b8fa58e32988b:2">â€”linking the user needs you've identified to potential features to build in your product.</span></span>

<span key="99cff4ebbbd64e389f5430b9c615e3b2"><span offset-key="99cff4ebbbd64e389f5430b9c615e3b2:0">Common tools for exploration include:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="02361407931b4a52a0d1ff238c0709db">**defining personas**<span offset-key="02361407931b4a52a0d1ff238c0709db:1"> of representative groups of potential users based on the data you've got (e.g., "Thomas is a 41-year-old bitcoin miner with a credit score of...")</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="177a1f2ebb0a472e854b3cebcfea2d4b">**drafting user stories**<span offset-key="177a1f2ebb0a472e854b3cebcfea2d4b:1"> (which you'll do in Labs!) to put yourself in the perspective of your users for each action they'll need to take to solve their problems (e.g., "As a user, I can specify a desired APR and see how much I'd have to pay in points to get that rate.")</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="4348b900c41c4083add24d2891e0fbcf">**prototyping**<span offset-key="4348b900c41c4083add24d2891e0fbcf:1"> early ideas for key areas of your product, possibly interactive (e.g., a clickable mockup of a rate comparison page)</span></span>

### 

<span key="aa5a66a68fdb48c0ae81fedccccb9351"><span offset-key="aa5a66a68fdb48c0ae81fedccccb9351:0">Testing & Feedback</span></span>

<span key="154f44d267274c78b718aeffc91b29be">**Testing**<span offset-key="154f44d267274c78b718aeffc91b29be:1"> is checking the performance of your application with specific metrics in mind; </span></span>

<span key="cc23efc7452e4ccf8c346185cf9d6912">**<span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span>**</span>

<span key="8edb812c7283469b885eaadd73d6815e">**feedback**<span offset-key="8edb812c7283469b885eaadd73d6815e:1"> is putting something in front of users to see how they react and/or what they say about their experience.</span></span>

### 

<span key="57918c68c7fd4045ab8f857310de6a8d"><span offset-key="57918c68c7fd4045ab8f857310de6a8d:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="608c8b0219454bfe8df004620f1dc370"><span offset-key="608c8b0219454bfe8df004620f1dc370:0">Common tools for testing & feedback include:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="2e8a7dad0cb8441dbd37285eb68a98d7">**usability testing**<span offset-key="2e8a7dad0cb8441dbd37285eb68a98d7:1"> to see what users say about how easy it was to accomplish their goals (e.g., "I felt like it look a lot of clicks to get to the part where I could finally view the rates.")</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="01e2912868004e8eab15b13ceadc2518">**deploying heatmaps**<span offset-key="01e2912868004e8eab15b13ceadc2518:1"> to see where users move their mouse, click, or even </span>*look*<span offset-key="01e2912868004e8eab15b13ceadc2518:3"> while using a version of your product (e.g., "Wow, look how much red is over the rate comparison button! We're really driving users effectively toward taking that primary action.")</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="047f1464754742e7b8f789c8375e247f">**user surveys**<span offset-key="047f1464754742e7b8f789c8375e247f:1"> to gather any other qualitative information (e.g., "How clear were the visualizations of interest rates over time?")</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="5b58f833f04847cbb991c78e0c950db9">**analytics**<span offset-key="5b58f833f04847cbb991c78e0c950db9:1"> for a deployed product (e.g., the number of daily active users (DAU))</span></span>

<span key="4d2944e4936d41979a460dfb0c8ae453"><span offset-key="4d2944e4936d41979a460dfb0c8ae453:0">Use these methods based on your best determination of when and with whom they'll be most relevant, based on the context, timeline, and goals of your product.</span></span>

<span key="b79140d224a244489cab7c3b4be0b501"><span offset-key="b79140d224a244489cab7c3b4be0b501:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="9e3f2c83e0de451f9ba887bbcd753c4f"><span offset-key="9e3f2c83e0de451f9ba887bbcd753c4f:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="edaaf30d20774ab2bbb888c59f710476"><span offset-key="edaaf30d20774ab2bbb888c59f710476:0">Interaction Design</span></span>

<span key="7ea37b82007f4a6c8f37b85b8a6ee684">**Interaction design**<span offset-key="7ea37b82007f4a6c8f37b85b8a6ee684:1"> (IxD) is another subset of UX that focuses on </span>**the junction between the user and the product.**</span>

<span key="4ff7d996daec458da92a1a8a3c09d4dd"><span offset-key="4ff7d996daec458da92a1a8a3c09d4dd:0">IxD tries to answer questions like:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="f4d4234b7ff34b979dd21cf40b54fa3c"><span offset-key="f4d4234b7ff34b979dd21cf40b54fa3c:0">How is a user inclined to interact with a product under certain circumstances?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="072bbd7d5b514738ad87f82a36372b0a"><span offset-key="072bbd7d5b514738ad87f82a36372b0a:0">How do we </span>*want*<span offset-key="072bbd7d5b514738ad87f82a36372b0a:2"> our users to interact with a particular product?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="3b421f61c4f94278accf3087a9545301"><span offset-key="3b421f61c4f94278accf3087a9545301:0">How do we drive user interactions to achieve product goals?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="405d40e4473f41c18979bb34baf0c9c6"><span offset-key="405d40e4473f41c18979bb34baf0c9c6:0">How can we build something that lets users accomplish their goals in an optimal way?</span></span>

## 

<span key="f722fb4f34024be8b2657e0126f7c8db"><span offset-key="f722fb4f34024be8b2657e0126f7c8db:0">The Five Dimensions Framework of Interaction Design</span></span>

<span key="efc01e69ffe34ec98db39619c3e36f81"><span offset-key="efc01e69ffe34ec98db39619c3e36f81:0">In 2007, </span></span><a href="https://www.uxmatters.com/mt/archives/2007/07/what-puts-the-design-in-interaction-design.php" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e10e94897a25465bbbdeb180d21082b9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-46006_259-46007-237__"><span data-key="6ca80d0cab2f4343b02db35930be9013"><span data-offset-key="6ca80d0cab2f4343b02db35930be9013:0">Kevin Silver (Links to an external site.)</span></span></span></a><span key="20bb6f6e1807462590282e1a0d1201f6"><span offset-key="20bb6f6e1807462590282e1a0d1201f6:0"> adapted </span></span><a href="http://feiramoderna.net/download/pos-positivo/MOGGRIDGE-Bill/DesigningInteractions_00_foreword.pdf" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="422548265a4e49e38642aa9dc8263459" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-46006_259-46007-237__"><span data-key="60cce1bb4e0343fdb76cc44c5f6f8346"><span data-offset-key="60cce1bb4e0343fdb76cc44c5f6f8346:0">Gillian Crampton Smith's (Links to an external site.)</span></span></span></a><span key="a6dd6ec5e5e446a0aaa1d0a3b9962432"><span offset-key="a6dd6ec5e5e446a0aaa1d0a3b9962432:0"> four "dimensions" of interaction design "languages" to add a fifth dimension, giving rise to the "Five Dimensions" framework:</span></span>

<span key="80ab06f517b8478db78fa9b3fe232973"><span offset-key="80ab06f517b8478db78fa9b3fe232973:0"> </span></span>

Dimension #

Dimension

Definition

<span key="426d688cad5343fc9afb35b4d04436ee"><span offset-key="426d688cad5343fc9afb35b4d04436ee:0">1-D</span></span>

<span key="85f946530c4444119f817adecb10909c"><span offset-key="85f946530c4444119f817adecb10909c:0">Words</span></span>

<span key="197ad396fdef4cee89d4ba67c1ad3b8e"><span offset-key="197ad396fdef4cee89d4ba67c1ad3b8e:0">Words are themselves interactions, and should be used with care.</span></span>

<span key="578cc4c5ca6846b9b735fa5cdff1561d"><span offset-key="578cc4c5ca6846b9b735fa5cdff1561d:0">2-D</span></span>

<span key="4307dff196c24b57a70eac5a6842ad1b"><span offset-key="4307dff196c24b57a70eac5a6842ad1b:0">Visual Representations</span></span>

<span key="0a909d6fc30d4a60b053421945a057dd"><span offset-key="0a909d6fc30d4a60b053421945a057dd:0">Typography, diagrams, icons, and other graphics with which users interact.</span></span>

<span key="9afe0ab80ef64c96891d5af13baa0afc"><span offset-key="9afe0ab80ef64c96891d5af13baa0afc:0">3-D</span></span>

<span key="a796ec5ceb0c43d7952eaa2a6b44082f"><span offset-key="a796ec5ceb0c43d7952eaa2a6b44082f:0">Physical Objects or Space</span></span>

<span key="f75c5cf4dcda4720a4910beeeea117d8"><span offset-key="f75c5cf4dcda4720a4910beeeea117d8:0">Objects with which or spaces within which users interact in the "real world".</span></span>

<span key="d653c07e9e7340cea53b5853b76966a8"><span offset-key="d653c07e9e7340cea53b5853b76966a8:0">4-D</span></span>

<span key="f621bf5951e7416f8dc2dbbcdf12583a"><span offset-key="f621bf5951e7416f8dc2dbbcdf12583a:0">Time</span></span>

<span key="f3f764d649a94f7b8c0bf3008f88282e"><span offset-key="f3f764d649a94f7b8c0bf3008f88282e:0">The time within which users interact (with content that changes over time).</span></span>

<span key="9454bafc31b84dc88ba5b1019d6dc986"><span offset-key="9454bafc31b84dc88ba5b1019d6dc986:0">5-D</span></span>

<span key="e7534115c911437b9240aa6018bbbac7"><span offset-key="e7534115c911437b9240aa6018bbbac7:0">Behavior</span></span>

<span key="b122a9f62ad04314aa348c6b56da4739"><span offset-key="b122a9f62ad04314aa348c6b56da4739:0">Action and reaction, including how users interact with the product.</span></span>

<span key="2f3012e0d4d746baadb42ca24aa6fb51"><span offset-key="2f3012e0d4d746baadb42ca24aa6fb51:0"> </span></span>

<span key="d760c43754394a3ead61a98608f99c2b"><span offset-key="d760c43754394a3ead61a98608f99c2b:0">These dimensions define different ways that users can interact with a productâ€”often all at once. They might be helpful to consider as your build a product, because they'll force you to be conscious of the fact that users will constantly have an impression along each dimension.</span></span>

<span key="af3d5a1c7d144dd68fa9f5f61b963762"><span offset-key="af3d5a1c7d144dd68fa9f5f61b963762:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="17e772e313184d1dbc6278288809c790"><span offset-key="17e772e313184d1dbc6278288809c790:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="e85ca9a26c9c4e93aa57d4545b08ff6a"><span offset-key="e85ca9a26c9c4e93aa57d4545b08ff6a:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="7fdd28cbbb9d451abad26f71e9e11d1f"><span offset-key="7fdd28cbbb9d451abad26f71e9e11d1f:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="2d9d9bb86e5149d9b2036796169bd150"><span offset-key="2d9d9bb86e5149d9b2036796169bd150:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<a href="design-tools.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-14lw9ot r-190qawg r-z2wwpe r-rs99b7 r-4dj0k7 r-1loqt21 r-1quu1zo r-1ro0kt6 r-18u37iz r-16y2uox r-1wbh5a2 r-nsbfu8 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>

<a href="ux-principles.html#the-five-dimensions-framework-of-interaction-design" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

The Five Dimensions Framework of Interaction Design
